body: I am also seeing this behavior and I was about to log an issue over it. I thought it never completed. It looks like it does but takes a very long time.

fast-list is a backend specific item so I'm guessing it wouldn't be on the union mount since not all things there would support it.

when you run the refresh on the Google Drive, which supports it, it works fast as it uses fast-list

fast-list itself does nothing on a 'mount' so it can be removed as well.

I wonder if you could add 

fast_list = true

to the config for the underlying remote in the rclone.conf and see a time difference as then it should use fast-list with the underlying remote that's part of the union.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/661

> I wonder if you could add
> 
> fast_list = true
> 
> to the config for the underlying remote in the rclone.conf and see a time difference as then it should use fast-list with the underlying remote that's part of the union.
> 
> #2697

In my use case I'm trying to union multiple Team Drives and I believe fast-list isn't recommended for Team Drives. The main advantage for me to use rclone union is I want a single systemd unit to manage it all vs mounting indv Team Drives and using something like Mergerfs to union them.

I think that depends on what you're doing against the team drives because of the delay in getting consistent reads.

"Warning: Rclone has detected that youâ€™re using --fast-list with sync/copy/move to or from a Google Team Drive remote. Due to the way Team Drives currently cache the full directory listing there can be situations where Rclone is unable to see recently created files on the drive and cause the command to miss or re-copy files. Running the command without --fast-list should allow Rclone to properly detect all files on the remote. Waiting a currently unknown amount of time after a file has been uploaded (Estimated to be less than an hour) should also be effective."

https://forum.rclone.org/t/fast-list-overwriting-and-endless-sync-with-gsuite-drive/8718/18

If you're mostly reading from the mount I think you're fine.  You could have two configs for the same remote with one just for the mount for reads.

I added `fast_list = true` to the Team Drive remotes and tried it. It seemed promising on team drives with little content. It took 5 mins for the refresh to complete on the small team drives however when I attempted it on Team Drives with more content it took over an hour. I can't tell you the exact time because I had the timeout set for 60 minutes and it timed out at that point.

> I wonder if you could add
> 
> fast_list = true
> 
> to the config for the underlying remote in the rclone.conf and see a time difference as then it should use fast-list with the underlying remote that's part of the union.
> 
> #661

I've got the same response times with `fast_list = true` in the config file ðŸ˜¢ .

> Could it be that it is not using the `--fast-list` option with the remote through the union mount point? Maybe it's just a not covered case

That is exactly the problem... The Union mount doesn't support --fast-list.

rename.from: vfs/refresh time with a union mount
rename.to: union: doesn't support --fast-list which slows down vfs/refresh

issue.title: Multiwrite union

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Enable multiple write support for union backend

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#2737 #3709 

#### Known issues

- Scheme of upstream fs is changed
- Creates a lot of unnecessary requests for some command (eg. sync)
- Cannot report an error when deleting an object hosted only on read-only remote

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: @Max-Sum what do you think about this issue as the next thing to work on for the union backend? It would be super useful for people using `vfs/refresh` with the recursive flag.

issue.title: union: implement --fast-list

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Implement fast list for union, enabled if all upstreams support.


#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#3000 

#### Checklist

- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
@Max-Sum has just implemented this and I've merged it to [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org).

Please give it a go :-)

Since both local and gdrive is used, I don't think my implementation could work though...
@ncw Do you think iterating for upstreams without ListR supported is fine?

@rsierra Yes, we face a dilemma here. If we enable fast list only when all upstreams support fast list, it would be a pity for local+remote case. However, if we enable it when one of the upstreams support, it would create unnecessary requests to the unsupported upstream and possibly damage the performance.

I could make a compromise, enable fast list if all upstreams are in one of these cases:
 - fast list supported
 - local
 - ram
What do you think @ncw?
